section.title: Prerequisite
section.p: The deployer node must be setup before deploying Ceph. For more details on the installation of deployer node, refer to installation guide.

section.title: Installation Procedure
section.p: Perform the following procedures to configure, install, and the integrate the Ceph Block Storage with HP Helion OpenStack 2.0.

ol.li: Create the Ceph configuration files (manually) at ~/helion-input/my_cloud/definition. The example configuration files are available at Ceph Configuration files.

Copy the configuration files in the respective folder as shown in the screeshot below.
You must copy the yml files in the appropriate folder. For example: Copy the ring.yml file in config/swift/.
Edit the configuration files, based on your environment, to deploy Ceph.
Edit the file disks_osd.yml and enter the details for the additional disks meant for OSD data and journal filesystems.vi disks_osd.yml
Commit your configuration to a local repository:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "<commit message>" Enter your commit message <commit message>
Run the configuration processor:cd ~/helion/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml
Change the directory to ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible and run the following command to create a deployment directory.ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Modify ~/helion/hlm/ansible/hlm-deploy.yml and uncomment the line containing ceph-deploy.yml to enable deployment of ceph.
Run the following ansible playbook:ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts site.yml

body.p: Ceph Monitor service is deployed on the Controller Nodes and OSD's are deployed as separate nodes (Resource Nodes).
Execute the following command to install the Ceph client packages on controller nodes.
This will also create Ceph users and Ceph pools on the resource nodes.

p.b: Configure Ceph as a Cinder backend

body.p:
Perform the following procedure on the Deployer node to configure Ceph as a Cinder backend:
Edit ~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/_CND-CMN/templates/cinder.conf.j2 to add ceph configuration data as shown below:enabled_backends=ceph1
Copy the following configurations:[ceph1] rbd_max_clone_depth = 5 rbd_flatten_volume_from_snapshot = False rbd_uuid = 457eb676-33da-42ec-9a8c-9293d545c337 rbd_user = cinder rbd_pool = volumes rbd_ceph_conf = /etc/ceph/ceph.conf volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.rbd.RBDDriver volume_backend_name = cephThe rbd_uuid is available at /home/stack/helion/hos/ansible/roles/ceph-client-prepare/vars/ceph_user_model.yml.
To enable cinder backup to Ceph, modify cinder.conf.j2 at ~/helion/hos/ansible/roles/_CND-CMN/templates/cinder.conf.j2 with the following values: backup_driver = cinder.backup.drivers.ceph backup_ceph_conf = /etc/ceph/ceph.conf backup_ceph_user = cinder-backup backup_ceph_chunk_size = 134217728 backup_ceph_pool = backups backup_ceph_stripe_unit = 0 backup_ceph_stripe_count = 0 restore_discard_excess_bytes = true
Copy ceph.client.cinder.keyring to the controller nodes:
Login to controller node as a root user and execute the following command.ceph auth get-or-create client.cinder | tee /etc/ceph/ceph.client.cinder.keyring
OR
You can copy the keyring from the deployer nodescp /etc/ceph/ceph.client.cinder.keyring to /etc/ceph folder on all the controller nodes.
Commit your configuration to the local repository to configure cinder on the deployer node.
cd /home/stack/helion/hos/ansible git add -A git commit -m "<commit message>" Enter your commit message <commit message>
Change the directory to ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible and run the following command to create a deployment directory.ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml
Run the following ansible playbook:ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts cinder-reconfigure.yml
Once cinder is configured, launch the Horizon dashboard to create a cinder volume type.

To create a volume type using the Horizon dashboard, do the following:
Log into the Horizon dashboard. The Horizon dashboard displays with the options in the left panel.
From the left panel, click the Admin tab and then click the Volumes tab to display the Volumes page.
Click Create Volume Type to display a dialog box.
Enter the name of the volume type.
Click Create Volume Type. The newly created volume displays in the Volumes page.

p.b: Associate the volume type to a backend

body.p: To map a volume type to a backend, do the following:

ol.li: Login to the Overcloud Horizon dashboard. The Overcloud dashboard displays with the options in the left panel.
From the left panel, click the Admin tab and then click the Volumes tab to display the Volumes page.

Click View Extra Specs displayed against the volume type which you want to associate to the backend.
The Create Volume Type Extra Specs dialog box displays.
In the Key box, enter ceph as volume backend name. This is the name of the key used to specify the storage backend when provisioning volumes of this volume type.
In the Value box, enter the name of the backend to which you want to associate the volume type. For example:ceph.
Click Create to create the extra volume type specs. Once the volume type is mapped to the backend, you can create volumes with this volume type.

section.p:
After the successful deployment of Ceph, you can perform the following Ceph operations:
Check the status of Ceph OSD and Monitor Services
Start OSD Nodes and Monitor Services
Stop OSD Nodes and Monitor Services
Check the status of Ceph OSD and Monitor Services
Perform the following steps to check the stays of Ceph OSD Nodes and Monitor Services:
Login to Deployer Node.
Change to the following directory:~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible
Run the ansible playbook:ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts ceph-status.yml
Start OSD and Monitor Services
Perform the following steps to start OSD Nodes and Monitor Services:
Login to Deployer Node.
Change to the following directory:cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible
Run the ansible playbook:ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts ceph-start.yml
Stop OSD Nodes and Monitor Services
Perform the following steps to stop OSD Nodes and Monitor Services:
Login to Deployer Node.
Change to the following directory:cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible
Run the ansible playbook:ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts ceph-stop.yml
